definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure
exterior surface/family relationship via females/to show (one's opinion)/a model/a table (listing information)/a form/a meter (measuring sth)

sentences.english: It will rain, for the barometer is falling.
sentences.chinese: 天將會下雨，因爲氣壓表正在下降。

sentences.english: A separate barometer of hiring also turned down.
sentences.chinese: 一項獨立的就業情況氣壓表也在下降。

sentences.english: Read the figure shown on the barometer, please.
sentences.chinese: 請你讀出氣壓表顯示的數字。

sentences.english: There are many ways of getting the height of a tall building with the aid of a barometer.
sentences.chinese: 有很多利用氣壓表來得知高樓的高度的方法。

sentences.english: As you climb the stairs, you mark off the length of the barometer along the wall.
sentences.chinese: 你一邊爬樓梯，一邊沿着牆壁標出氣壓表的長度。
氣壓表的水銀柱在上升。

sentences.english: The beauty of this method is that you don't have to drop the barometer and break it.
sentences.chinese: 這個辦法的好處是你不必把氣壓表扔下去，摔個稀爛。

sentences.english: Drop the barometer and time its fall with a stopwatch.
sentences.chinese: 扔下氣壓表，用秒錶測出它降落的時間。
